org.threadly.litesockets.utils

Class MergedByteBuffers

  • java.lang.Object
    • org.threadly.litesockets.utils.MergedByteBuffers
  • Direct Known Subclasses:
    TransactionalByteBuffers

    public class MergedByteBuffers
extends java.lang.Object
    This class is used to combine multiple ByteBuffers into 1 simplish to use interface. It provides most of the features of a single ByteBuffer, but with the ability to perform those operations spanning many ByteBuffers. The Idea here is to keep from having to copy around and merge ByteBuffers as much as possible.

      • add

        public void add(java.nio.ByteBuffer buffer)
        This method allows you to add ByteBuffers to the Consolidator. All must be done in order of how you want to pull the data back out
        Parameters:
        buffer - - The byte buffer to add to the consolidator

      • get

        public void get(byte[] destBytes)
        Parameters:
        destBytes - - fills the given byteArray with the next bytes from the consolidator. NOTE: do not give a byteArray bigger then the remaining size left in the consolidator.

      • pop

        public java.nio.ByteBuffer pop()
        Get the next Complete ByteBuffer in its entirety. This byteBuffer could be any size and it will just pull it off the queue and return it.
        Returns:

        Returns:
